organization.name: fao

title: Country experience on GHG inventory: Africa

resources.name: Democratic Republic of Congo: support on institutional arrangement and GHG inventory for AFOLU sector
resources.description: Support to the GHG inventory is given in the context of the production of the first and second Biennial Update Report. The programme will continue till 2020.

resources.name: CÃ´te d'Ivoire: support on institutional arrangements
resources.description: Support to the GHG inventory is given in the context of the production of the  Biennial Update Report and the National Communication.  A workplan  for the next phase fd includes the organization of a national workshop on the AFOLU component of the inventory with the objective to gather all the relevant departments and sensibilize them on the importance to share their data and statistics with the inventory team.

resources.name: Benin: support on upgrading GHG inventory and QA/QC
resources.description: Upgrading of inventories from tier 1 to tier 2, methods and strategies for the gap filling of data and the estimate of specific parameters for the Agriculture section of the inventory, including the use of FAO databases, as well as the upgrading of the land representation from approach 1 to 2 and 3.

A three days training based on IPCC 2006 Guidelines at tier 1 and on the FAO-MICCA e-learning curriculum on national GHG inventories for AFOLU was given in Bamako to sixteen officers selected by the governmental Agency for Environment and Sustainable Development (AEDD). The training covered all agriculture sources and processes as well the generic methodologies for the FOLU sector through presentations and hands-on exercises. The trained officers are expected in the short term to contribute to all stages of production of the inventories for the next national reports, namely the first Biennial Update Report of Mali.
resources.name: Mali: support on GHG inventory for the AFOLU sector
Ethiopia: training on GHG inventory for the AFOLU sector
resources.description: Five days training based on IPCC 2006 Guidelines at tier 1 and the FAO-MICCA e-learning curriculum on national GHG inventories for AFOLU was given to 25 experts coming from different level of administrations (Federal, Regional and City Administration) and involved in climate change related activities. The training took place in Addis Ababa in March 2018 and covered all agriculture sources and processes as well the generic methodologies for the FOLU sector, through presentations and hands-on exercises using the IPCC software.

notes: Under the transparency framework, FAO provides countries with technical support on enhancing institutional arrangements for the nationals GHG inventory system (NIS), preparing a national GHG inventory for the Agriculture, Forestry and Other Land Uses (AFOLU) sector, estimate the Forest Reference Level (FRL) and guarantee the Quality Assurance/Quality Control (QA/QC) and verification procedures of the GHG inventory before submissions to UNFCCC.

groups.name: climate-change-mitigation
groups.description: If the global food supply is to keep pace with population growth and dietary changes, agricultural productivity must increase. Changes in agricultural practices can help the world not only to meet its targets for reducing greenhouse gas emissions but also to contribute to food security.
groups.title: Climate Change Mitigation

name: country-experience-on-ghg-inventory-africa
